Code

All the code can be found in github.com/filyp/tree-of-tags.

Clustering

First, we calculate which tags cooccur with each other. With this we create a graph where tags are nodes, and edge weights are the number of their cooccurences.

This graph is then clustered hierarchichally with the Krakow algorithm. It outputs a tree, that you can climb to narrow down on some subtopic.

There are many possible ways to cluster a graph. For each forum I chose 3 best distinct clusterings. I documented this process in this notebook.

Democracy and meritocracy

Democratic scores are computed as:
\(num\_of\_upvotes + num\_of\_strong\_upvotes - num\_of\_downvotes - num\_of\_strong\_downvotes\)
Karma isn't taken into account at all.

Meritocratic scores are computed as:
\(normal\_score - democratic\_score\)
So only the points which are due to high karma are counted.

To make the contrast between those two scorings starker, all the posts are split into two equal groups based on the ratio of \(meritocratic\_score/democratic\_score\). So when you choose for example the meritocratic ranking, you will only see the posts from the "meritocratic group". Unless there's too few of them - then, the other group will be used too.
